article.headline: Buffalo 80, Ball State 72
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Calvin Cage had 30 points and helped Buffalo stave off a frantic Ball State rally in the Bulls' 80-72 win in the first round of the Mid-American Conference tournament on Monday night. No. 8 seed Buffalo (19-12) advanced to the quarterfinal round and will play top-seeded Kent State on Thursday night. The ninth-seeded Cardinals (10-18) were led by Skip Mills, who had a career-high 38 points in the loss. Down by 16 at the break, Ball State went on a 20-8 run to cut the lead to 52-48 with 11:30 remaining in regulation. Mills had 11 points during the spurt, including three 3-pointers. The Bulls responded with a quick 8-0 run to build their lead back to 12, but the Cardinals chipped away at the advantage and trailed by four points (69-65) with under 4 minutes to go. Cage was then able to hit eight consecutive free throws to seal the win. Mario Jordan added 17 points and seven rebounds for Buffalo, which lost to Ohio in overtime in last year's MAC championship game. D'Andre Peyton contributed 11 points for the Cardinals.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
